basics.name: Xiaofeng Wang
basics.summary: M.S. student at Shanghai Jiao Tong University focusing on LLM agents, multi-agent RL, reasoning, and alignment.

work.name: ByteDance
work.summary: Participated in R&D and optimization of Doubao multi-agent architecture.
highlights: Worked on chat mode, Deep Research mode, and Super Mode architecture improvements.

work.name: Taotian Group (Xianyu)
work.summary: Upgraded multi-agent and E2E systems for AI consignment and social dialogue tasks.
highlights: Improved seller penetration by nearly 40% among completed transactions.
Explored MARL and adaptive preference alignment; achieved Sotopia SOTA and exceeded GPT-4o by 14.7% on goal completion.

work.name: ByteDance (Trae)
work.summary: Designed multi-agent workflow and long-context code compression for code generation.
highlights: Built RAG-based code compression with >98% target-file recall on SWE-bench.
Contributed to Fast Apply model training; 7B fine-tuned model reached >99% merge accuracy and 4-10x speedup.

work.name: Ant Group
work.summary: Built and evaluated multi-agent debt collection negotiation systems.
highlights: Designed evaluation and optimization paradigm for LLM debt-collection dialogue.
Built reward-model data workflow with over 90% consistency to human labeling.

publications.name: Do Large Language Models Truly Understand Geometric Structures?
Debt Collection Negotiations with Large Language Models: An Evaluation System and Optimizing Decision Making with Multi-Agent.
Weak-to-strong Preference Optimization: Stealing Reward from Weak Aligned Model.
Enhancing Social Intelligence in LLMs with Hierarchical Reasoning and Utterance-Level Goal Rewarding.
Evaluating Bargaining Skills in Online Second-Hand Marketplace with LLM Seller Agents.
